hook.text: Two small organs the size of almonds hold the power to create every future generation of humans.

buildup.text: Ovaries sit on either side of the uterus, connected by the delicate fallopian tubes.

discovery.text: They produce eggs and release hormones like estrogen and progesterone that regulate the whole body.

twist.text: A baby girl is born with roughly two million eggs. By puberty, only about 300,000 remain.

climax.text: Despite their tiny size, ovaries control fertility, bone health, mood, and even heart function.

punchline.text: Small as almonds, powerful as command centers.
